sn12.30:4.3: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t understand old age and death, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation. It’s impossible that they will abide having transcended old age and death.
sn12.30:4.13: They don’t understand choices, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation. It’s impossible that they will abide having transcended old age and death.
sn12.30:5.1: There are ascetics and brahmins who do understand old age and death, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation. It’s possible that they will abide having transcended old age and death.
sn12.30:5.11: They understand choices, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation.
sn12.30:5.12: It’s possible that they will abide having transcended choices.”
